metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000025 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNOME Web (Epiphany) 3.23 before 3.23.5, 3.22 before 3.22.6, 3.20 before 3.20.7, 3.18 before 3.18.11, and prior versions, is vulnerable to a password manager sweep attack resulting in the remote exfiltration of stored passwords for a selected set of websites.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-1000025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

epiphany-browser - 3.28.6-0ubuntu1
epiphany-browser-data - 3.28.6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: epiphany package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
epiphany-browser package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.28.6-0ubuntu1').
